properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 3 at 6:18AM MST until February 4 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...MORE SNOW EXPECTED FOR THE TUSAS MOUNTAINS...

.A storm system will bring wintry weather to the Tusas Mountains
starting mid day, and continuing through Tuesday. Up to 8 inches
of snowfall is possible across the peaks and west facing slopes.
Much of the snowfall will occur this afternoon and evening, but
light snow may continue off and on through Tuesday. High terrain
roadways will become snowpacked and icy.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches,
except 5 to 8 inches above 7500 feet. Winds gusting as high as
35 mph today.

* WHERE...Tusas Mountains Including Chama.

* WHEN...From 11 AM Monday to 6 PM MST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of falling and blowing
snow may reduce visibility Monday afternoon and evening below
2 miles. Travelling along Highway 64 may become difficult.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MST TUESDAY
